page.title: 03ST.MICHAEL'S MOUNT HISTORY-2
page.content:
In 1659 the Mount was bought by Colonel John St. Aubyn, who made it a {private house.}It continued to belong to the St. Aubyn family until 1954. Many improvements and additions were made to the castle and other buildings over the years. In 1887 the seventh baronet was granted a peerage and became the first Lord St. Levan.
The Mount continued to belong to the St. Aubyn family until 1954, when Lord St. Levan gave the Mount to the {National Trust}for Places of Historic Interest or Natural Beauty. Part of the castle and grounds were leased to the St. Aubyn family who continue to live there.
The Mount is a major{tourist {attraction}and is visited by thousands of visitors each year.
